definition: highlight/bright spot
bright/clear/resonant/to shine/to show/to reveal

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: A major highlight of the ceremony is a unique paper-cut fashion show.
sentences.chinese: 颁奖典礼上一大亮点就是独特的剪纸时装秀。

sentences.english: The summit of Western Banquet activities will be the biggest bright spot.
sentences.chinese: 本次峰会的西餐夜宴将是活动的最大亮点。

sentences.english: Bruni also dives deep to offer some surprises on non-elite public schools.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁尼还深入挖掘了一些非名校的公立大学的亮点。

sentences.english: In addition, a major highlight of the ceremony is a unique paper-cut fashion show.
sentences.chinese: 另外，在颁奖典礼上一大亮点就是独特的剪纸时装秀。

sentences.english: The generation of classroom teaching is a light-spot in implementing new courses.
sentences.chinese: 课堂教学的“生成”，是实施新课程的一大亮点。

sentences.english: Tourism may become a new bright spot in our bilateral cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 旅游可以成为双边合作的新亮点。

sentences.english: Mengcun construction fastener has become a new bright spot in economic development.
sentences.chinese: 在建筑扣件已成为孟村经济发展中的新亮点。

sentences.english: The picturesque city of Fez is anther aspects of Morocco.
sentences.chinese: 非斯这个独特的城市也是摩洛哥的一个亮点。

sentences.english: P. Morgan's big win came in fixed-income markets.
sentences.chinese: 摩根大通当季业绩最大亮点来自于固定收益市场。

sentences.english: The local autonomy of Shanghai was a highlight of local political practice in the late Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 上海地方自治是清末地方政治实践的一个亮点。

sentences.english: Yellow stripes on head and light spot on each marginal scute .
sentences.chinese: 头部两边有黄色条纹且头顶有亮点。

sentences.english: Developing the forest tourism industry energetically has become the new bright spot of the landscape planning.
sentences.chinese: 大力发展森林旅游业，成为景观规划的新亮点。

sentences.english: Africa will be the highlight of an otherwise dismal year.
sentences.chinese: 非洲将是这异常凄凉的一年里的亮点。

sentences.english: What were your highlights of the 2010 Betfred. com World Snooker Championship?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得2010年世界斯诺克锦标赛的亮点是什么？

sentences.english: Marin Cilic vs. Marcos Baghdatis would be a highlight of the third round.
sentences.chinese: 第三轮，西里奇与巴格达蒂斯是一亮点。

sentences.english: Ma Xiaohui's solo beautifully represents Chinese culture in Norway's Pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 马晓辉的独奏成为挪威馆里中国元素的突出亮点。

definition: a faulty stroke in calligraphy or painting/a faulty expression in writing
remarkable (performance, achievement etc)/worthy of praise
characteristic/distinguishing feature or quality
the brush stroke that dots in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
new idea
qualities that make sth worth seeing (or reading)
conforming with the norms of society
short stave of the barrel (which allows the contents to escape)/(fig.) shortcoming/weak point
everything is fine except for one small defect (idiom); the fly in the ointment
eye-catching
eye-catching

to strike a pose (Chinese opera)/(fig.) to make a public appearance/to come out in public (revealing one's true personality, opinions etc)/(of a product) to appear on the market or at a trade show etc
focus/focal point
to enrich/to enhance/to beautify
characteristic (feature)/trait/feature/CL:個|个[ge4]
important point/main point/focus/key (project etc)/to focus on/to put the emphasis on
to recount (e.g. results of election)/to re-evaluate
